intro: Ligusticum ajanense var. angustissimum, commonly known as narrowleaf Chinese lovage, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a strong, pungent odor. The flowering stems bear small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which attract various pollinators.
